verses.verse: David<WH1732> fled<WH1272> from Naioth<WH5121> in Ramah,<WH7414> and came<WH935> and said<WH559> before<WH6440> Jonathan,<WH3083> "What have I done?<WH6213> What is my iniquity?<WH5771> What is my sin<WH2403> before<WH6440> your father,<WH1> that he seeks<WH1245> my life?<WH5315>"

Then David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Jonathan,<WH3083> "Who shall tell<WH5046> me if perchance your father<WH1> answers<WH6030> you roughly?<WH7186>"

It happened on the next day<WH4283> after the new moon,<WH2320> the second<WH8145> day,<WH1732> that David's place<WH4725> was empty.<WH6485> Saul<WH7586> said<WH559> to Jonathan<WH3083> his son,<WH1121> "Why doesn't<WH1121> the son of Jesse<WH3448> come<WH935> to eat,<WH3899> neither yesterday,<WH8543> nor today?<WH3117>"

He said,<WH559> <WH7971> 'Please let me go, for our family<WH4940> has a sacrifice<WH2077> in the city.<WH5892> My brother<WH251> has commanded<WH6680> me to be there.<WH4672> Now, if I have found favor<WH2580> in your eyes,<WH5869> please let me go away<WH4422> and see<WH7200> my brothers.<WH251>' Therefore he has not come<WH935> to the king<WH4428>'s table.<WH7979>"

Then Saul<WH7586>'s anger<WH639> was kindled<WH2734> against Jonathan,<WH3083> and he said<WH559> to him,<WH1121> "You son of a perverse<WH5753> rebellious<WH4780> woman,<WH3045> don't I know that you have chosen<WH977> the son<WH1121> of Jesse<WH3448> to your own shame,<WH1322> and to the shame<WH1322> of your mother<WH517>'s nakedness?<WH6172>

Jonathan<WH3083> answered<WH6030> Saul<WH7586> his father,<WH1> and said<WH559> to him,<WH4191> "Why should he be put to death? What has he done?<WH6213>"
Saul<WH7586> cast<WH2904> his spear<WH2595> at him to strike<WH5221> him.<WH3083> By this Jonathan knew<WH3045> that his father<WH1> was determined<WH3617> to put David<WH1732> to death.<WH4191>

So Jonathan<WH3083> arose<WH6965> from the table<WH7979> in fierce<WH2750> anger,<WH639> and ate<WH398> no food<WH3899> the second<WH8145> day<WH3117> of the month;<WH2320> for he was grieved<WH6087> for David,<WH1732> because his father<WH1> had done him shame.<WH3637>
